properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Craigieburn, Donnybrook, Wollert, Woodstock.
  • There is a fire on Summerhill Road, Wollert.
  • The fire is under control. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 01:59 am on Sunday 04 December. 
There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do:
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • If you are sensitive to smoke or you live with someone who is sensitive to smoke, you should close windows and doors. Turn off heating and cooling systems. 
  • To prevent the smell of smoke entering your home or business, close windows and doors.  
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services are monitoring the scene.

This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 07/01/2026 11:00 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility:

The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.

  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.  
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - INDUSTRIAL FIRE - Stay Informed
Incident Location: Summerhill Rd, Wollert
Issue Date: Monday 05 January 2026, 10:09 am
Next Update: Wednesday 07 January 2026, 11:00 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38925/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Craigieburn, Donnybrook, Wollert, Woodstock.
- There is a fire on Summerhill Road, Wollert.
- The fire is under control. 
- Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
- This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 01:59 am on Sunday 04 December. 


There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bullioh, Bungil, Granya, Thologolong.
  • This Watch and Act warning is for the area west of Mt Lawson State Park
  • There is a bushfire at 25 km from Walwa that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling within the Mt Lawson National Park in a south-easterly direction.
  • Predicted weather conditions are likely to make fire fighting challenging. Please consider moving stock to a safe and defendable location as conditions can change rapidly without notice.
  • This Watch and Act replaces the 'Watch and Act - Monitor Conditions' message issued at 5.56am, 6 January 2026.

The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • Move stock early if possible.
  • Defending a house requires: At least two fit and determined adults who are physically and mentally prepared to work long and hard in arduous and difficult conditions. At least 10,000 litres of water (not from mains supply which can fail during a fire). Protective clothing. Appropriate firefighting hoses and pumps.
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are currently driving slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Mt Lawson State Park is closed until further notice.
  • The Murray River Road is currently open, but can and will be closed if required.
  • If you intend on leaving the area, travel west towards Wodonga away from the Mt Lawson State Park.
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
  • Embers start small fires ahead of the main fire.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 06/01/2026 02:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Tongala.
  • There is a grassfire at Henderson Rd, Tongala.
  • There are piles of compost that are burning and will issue smoke for some time which will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Firefighters are on scene and will continue to monitor this fire. 
  • This Community Information message replaces the Community Information issued at 5:37pm.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.location: Burrowye, Guys Forest, Bungil, Koetong, Mount Alfred, Thologolong
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bungil, Burrowye, Guys Forest, Koetong, Mount Alfred, Thologolong.
  • There is a bushfire at 25km west of Walwa that is not yet under control.
  • This warning is for the east of Mt Lawson State Park.
  • The bushfire is travelling within the Mt Lawson National Park in a south-easterly direction.
  • Predicted weather conditions are likely to make firefighting challenging. Please consider moving stock to a safe and defendable location as conditions can change rapidly without notice. 
  • This Watch and Act replaces the 'Watch and Act - Monitor Conditions' that was issued this morning at 5:53am. 
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • Move stock early if possible. 
  • Defending a house requires: At least two fit and determined adults who are physically and mentally prepared to work long and hard in arduous and difficult conditions. At least 10,000 litres of water (not from mains supply which can fail during a fire). Protective clothing. Appropriate firefighting hoses and pumps.
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are currently driving slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Mt Lawson State Park is closed until further notice. 
  • The Murray River Road is currently open, but can and will be closed if required.
  • If you intend on leaving the area, travel east towards Coryong away from Mt Lawson State Park. 
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Bushfires can start spot fires and embers can travel large distances ahead of the main fire.
  • Embers start small fires ahead of the main fire.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 06/01/2026 02:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Samaria, Tatong.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice message issued at 8.04 pm Monday, January 5. 
  • There is a small 2.7 hectare bushfire on Tatong-Tolmie Rd in Tatong that is contained.  
  • Ground crews will continue working the fire, including heavy machinery and equipment.
Road closures are in place around the fire area: see Impacts in your area

Police are in attendance and travel through the fire area is for emergency vehicle travel only.
  • Monitor Conditions 
  • There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Road closures in place around the fire area: 
Traffic management points are now in place in the Tolmie area:
  • Tatong to Tolmie Road and Spring Creek Road
  • Tatong to Tolmie Road and Mansfield-Whitfield Rd
Police are in attendance and travel through the fire area is for emergency vehicle travel only.

Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 07/01/2026 09:40 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: A J Burkitt Oval and Banyule Flats Reserve, Heidelberg
properties.webBody:
This Advice message has been issued for the A J Burkitt Oval and Banyule Flats Reserve, Heidelberg.

  • A sinkhole has occurred in the immediate area of the A J Burkitt Oval and Banyule Flats Reserve in Heidelberg.
Stay informed. Stay away from the sinkhole. The sinkhole may continue to grow in size.
What you should do:
  • Stay away from the area to allow emergency services to provide assistance.
  • Stay safe by avoiding any damaged buildings, fallen trees and powerlines, blocked or damaged roads.
  • Be aware of other hazards caused by the sinkhole.
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services have set up an exclusion zone around the area to keep community members safe.
  • Traffic in the area may be impacted as emergency services and relevant authorities respond.
  • Please keep the roads clear, and do not attempt to access the warning area.
This message was issued by State Emergency Service.

The next update is expected by 06/01/2026 05:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#viclandslide).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact the National Relay Service and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Bungil, Burrowye, Thologolong.
  • There is a bushfire at 27Km West Of Walwa that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Mt Lawson National Park in a north-westerly direction towards the Murray River Road.
  • Please view this message alongside the Watch and Act messages that are published. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Bulldozers and aircraft are operating in the area.
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (www.traffic.transport.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 06/01/2026 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
